page.title: 03LOCAL HISTORY-BROADWELL
page.content: he name BROADWELL comes from the well, round which Broadwell was built.This is a natural spring and has never been known to dry up,not even during the drought of 1976.The present well was built in 1901 and then rebuilt in 1979.It was lined with limestone,and has two feet of bricks at the top. Broadwell does not have a Pub,as its original Pub was closed in the 1700's,after a man was stabbed to death,following a drunken fight. The oldest building in Broadwell is the barn which was built in Elizabethan Times.There used to be a Church,but this was destroyed by the Roundheads in the Civil War. To the S-W of Broadwell is Nelson's Quarry.This provided much of the limestone to build the houses.The quarrywas closed in the 1950's and is now flooded to a depth of 10 metres.
